title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 February 2014 - XWiki

10:22 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:27 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <vmassol> so you found a solution in the end mflorea? :)  
11:51 <mflorea> yep, it was our fault, not Solr  
11:51 <vmassol> cool  
11:53 <mflorea> I went on the wrong track at first because I forgot we have a "filter" that filters the results returned by Solr, including the documents that don't exist anymore, so I really though the documents were deleted from the Solr index, while in fact they were delete only from the XWiki database.  
11:53 <mflorea> moving to the next issues  
11:53 <vmassol> ok!  
12:03 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
12:11 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <Danilo> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <Danilo> Hello, I am trying to use the getName()   method, however it is Deprecated. since 2.2M1 used getDocumentReference() instead  
12:54 <Danilo> I could not find information about the getDocumentReference  
12:54 <Danilo> How can I get a name of a page in this new method?  
12:55 <lucaa> has quit  
13:07 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <lucaa> has quit  
13:47 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:52 <vmassol> @Danilo: getName() on what class?  
13:53 <vmassol> did you check the SRD?  
13:53 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/SRD/Navigation  
13:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: sounds like XWikiDocument (that the only deprecated getName() I have in mind)  
13:57 <evalica> has quit  
13:57 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <tmortagne> Danilo: you have a getName() in the DocumentReference which give you what getName() give  
13:59 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: if it's XWikiDocument then there's a getDocumentReference() too but Danilo says  he cannot find in it which is strange  
14:12 <vmassol> s/in it/it  
14:12 <vmassol> let's see what he says  
14:12 <vmassol> BTW  
14:13 <vmassol> I don't see a getName on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/SRD/Navigation  
14:13 <vmassol> for $xwiki  
14:13 <vmassol> (nor getDocumentReference)  
14:18 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:24 <Danilo> The problem is that I am in the page http://maven.xwiki.org/site/xwiki-core-parent/xwiki-core/apidocs/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.html#getName%28%29  
14:26 <Danilo> this page is saying me to use getDocumentReference() but when I explore this link, i get on a broken link  
14:26 <Danilo> http://xwiki.org/xwiki-core-parent/xwiki-core-model/apidocs/org/xwiki/model/reference/DocumentReference.html  
14:31 <ClemensR> for some reason the 4.1.x dos are better "interlinked"  
14:32 <ClemensR> e.g. http://maven.xwiki.org/site/docs/xwiki-javadoc-4.1.x/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Document.html  links well to http://maven.xwiki.org/site/docs/xwiki-javadoc-4.1.x/org/xwiki/model/reference/DocumentReference.html  
14:40 <Denis> mflorea: Have you change something recently that could have fixed XWIKI-8207 ? I do not reproduce anymore with 5.4.1 in the same exact test case I had before.  
14:44 <mflorea> Denis: no, I don't think so :), but again, I wasn't able to reproduce it before  
14:45 <Denis> mflorea: curious, it does not happen anymore, while I was able to reproduce it all the time  
14:45 <evalica> has quit  
14:45 <mflorea> +1  
14:48 <Denis> mflorea: is that expected that the DW does not trigger immediately after creating a new wiki ?  
14:49 <mflorea> I noticed this a few times but I don't know why it happens. Maybe tmortagne knows.  
14:49 <Denis> he said exactly the same :)  
14:49 <mflorea> in my case I had to reload the page  
14:49 <Denis> for me it never get in until I reload, this is not very friendly  
14:50 <mflorea> well, I don't see how it could be related to the client side, IMO it must be something on the server side, on the distribution job status  
14:50 <Denis> do I open an issue ?  
14:51 <mflorea> and the fact that it works after a page reload tells me it's not related to the velocity code. Maybe the job is updated with a delay, after the page is requested.  
14:51 <mflorea> you can report an issue sure  
15:12 <Danilo> thank you clemens, i could find the documantation now  
15:14 <Danilo> People, is it possible to pop up a warning windows in Xwiki? I wrote a listener script that will start a approvation flow.. i would like to warn the user that the flow started after save the document.  
15:29 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:51 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:54 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <tmortagne> Denis: we already talked about that and I told you to create a jira issue last time...  
15:59 <Denis> tmortagne: I have reported the view initialization issue, not the fact that the DW does not get triggered immediately yet  
16:00 <tmortagne> we talked about both and told you to report an issue whenever you can reproduce it often  
16:00 <tmortagne> I even explained to you what is happening

17:18 <mflorea> vmassol?  
17:18 <vmassol> the commit  
17:18 <vmassol> your last commit  
17:18 <mflorea> sure

17:34 <sdumitriu> has quit  
17:59 <sdumitriu1> mflorea: Pong  
18:08 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
18:13 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
18:22 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:23 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:26 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
18:27 <mflorea> sdumitriu: I encountered a strange problem on an old XWiki instance, 2.6.2 I think. The user can attach an image but when he clicks on it under the attachments tab the browser (Firefox) detects a redirect loop. I've checked the image URL, it looks fine except that it has ?srid=xxxx in the query string. If I remove it I'm redirected back to the the same URL with srid back.  
18:28 <mflorea> I know srid stands for saved request id, do you know/remember any issues/bug that might cause this redirect loop?  
18:29 <mflorea> afaics there are two places that set the srid on the URL: (1) the csrf token and (2) MyFormAuthenticator.  
18:29 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:35 <sdumitriu> mflorea: Was that behind a proxy/load balancer?  
18:36 <sdumitriu> Or a custom authenticator?  
18:36 <mflorea> I need to check, I don't know  
18:36 <mflorea> (will take a while though before I get an answer :) )  
18:37 <Sidali\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:37 <sdumitriu> The one thing that I can think of is IP-locked cookies  
18:38 <mflorea> ok, thanks  
18:38 <sdumitriu> One request fails to authenticate, and redirects to /login/, but this one properly authenticates and redirects back to /download/, which gets in a loop  
18:38 <sdumitriu> Or something like that  
18:38 <mflorea> indeed  
18:38 <Sidali> has quit  
18:38 <Sidali\_> is now known as <Sidali>  
18:38 <sdumitriu> httpheaders is a better extension for debugging that  
18:40 <mflorea> ok, thanks Sergiu  
18:41 <sdumitriu> Firebug doesn't show redirects that well  
18:41 <sdumitriu> http://livehttpheaders.mozdev.org/  
18:43 <mflorea> I haven't use it but I'll give it a try  
18:50 <vmassol> guys please check http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/DownloadFormFeedback  
18:50 <vmassol> I've updated it with latest feedback
